intro: Dibridsonia culionensis, commonly known as the Culion palm, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of Culion in the Philippines. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in limestone soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish-green color, and it produces edible fruits that are important to local communities. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
